Reviews.Title: “The worst ever!”
Reviews.Author: CarolineNoon
Reviews.Content: Our flight was cancelled and we had to find quick accomodation for 2 days. We booked this hotel simply because of it's location and the fact that it was graded as 4 star - this is the last time I book using the stars as an indication of hotel quality and without reading reviews. The hotel is needing refurbished but this we could live with. The rain started on the day we arrived so the room was cold and damp. I attempted to turn the heating on but couldn't get it to work. I spoke to the man at reception who barely acknowledged that I was there and told me the heating had been switched off as it was hot enough - honestly!! I thought that it was up to me to control my room temperature but not at this hotel. By day 2 of the rain, the room was really cold and damp, not helped by the fact that the bathroom fan didn't work and we had to use the hairdryer to de-mist the mirror and to help dry our clothes and shoes. The bedding was beginning to feel damp by now however the extra blanket in the wardrope was dirty with staining and the top cover on our bed had holes in it. It was no better than a hostel and 2stars would be pushing it. We chose not to complain further as it was clear the staff were there to take our money and hand over the key and service was not part of their job. We would have moved hotel except we had booked through bookng.com and would not get a refund. The windows were not sound proofed which made sleeping really difficult with the noise of constant traffic and people shouting and bawling all night. The walls are paper thin aswell and the people in the room next to us leaving at 5.30am was a new experience altogether for us. After having stayed 4 days at the AXEL in Barcelona which was superb then moving to this place which really was the pits, it was a real let down. The disappointment in not getting home was bad enough but this made everything worse and has really tainted my memories of Barcelona. I have certainly learned my lesson and will NEVER book another place without first referring to reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: RosannaCoates
Reviews.Content: My husband and I also stayed 23rd to 26th March 2012. We also were expecting the worst due to the previous reviews. In actual fact it wasn't bad at all. O.K. we don't think it is our 4 star standard, as no Tea & Coffee making facilities in room, bar closed, mini bar empty. Charged 2 Euros per day to use the room safe. The only staff we saw were 1 male receptionist and a cleaner. Having said that, the room was very nice and clean. Breakfast was what we expected, (no other meals available) . But the Hotel is in an excellent position for touring, places to eat and drink.(Public conveniences as we know them ,non existent.) Hold on to your personal possessions as I had my camera stolen and another lady from our group had her handbag stolen.

Reviews.Title: “A moment of reality”
Reviews.Author: MartinWellock
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel along with 9 friends over the weekend 23rd to 26th March 2012. This was really by default, as the hotel Rialto with whom I had been booked had a problem of some form or other and we got moved at the last minute. I checked tripadvisor regarding the Barcino, to be frankly horrified at the adverse reviews displayed. Frankly it made Faulty Towers seem like the Ritz and I attempted to get my party moved but due to time constraints found it impossible. My group arrived at the hotel with much trepidation having read reviews that spoke of a "Run down and filthy hotel, badly designed and pretentious", a hotel with bedroom doors that had no working locks. There were others that identified rude and unhelpful staff and inedible breakfasts. There were several that implored us to avoid the hotel at all costs, including one idiot that told the world at large he/she "Would not send my worst enemy to this hotel !"; I mean what kind of review is that ? Nonetheless, we arrived and what did we find ?. A light and very clean hotel, with efficient and courteous staff on reception. The bedrooms varied in size and my own had a very comfortable bed; our bathroom was of a generous size with an excellent shower Our breakfasts were entirely adequate and plentiful. I take the criticism made concerning lack of facilities within bedrooms to make a hot drink but there are hot drink machines available to make up the deficiency....Oh, one last thing; regarding the two seater lift. I can only imagine the person making the observation that it was not big enough to hold more that two may one of those larger persons who might have problems with seating in aircraft( If you get my drift).The point is that there is nothing at all wrong with the hotel. I firmly believe that people have a tendency to use sites like Tripadvisor to make salacious remarks masquerading as complaints, in many cases not even to bother to try evidencing them. This can give a false picture of the hotel or restaurant in question. It would also be of great assistance to us potential future customers if the hotel had given a response to the various attacks made upon it............This hotel is well placed and does what it says on the tin. Value for money

Reviews.Title: “Stay away.”
Reviews.Author: austinfriars
Reviews.Content: Arrived for one night only..one old guy at reception..two people could only fit in elevator..room dreadful..no luxury..small Spanish speaking televisions that are not better than a black and white set..don't make a mistake..pics are not justified..the worst hotel I have overstayed..2 star at best,sorry about review but it's the truth..thx god I was alone and not with family..I only had to suffer

Reviews.Title: “PETE AND ANN”
Reviews.Author: peterbowman9254
Reviews.Content: we have just returned from a city break in barcelona and stayed at the run down filthy hotel barcino we booked this thinking we would have a bit of luxury etc etc this hotel is not 4 star and it would be pushing a 2 star it possible a 4 star hostel there was no tea making facility no bar the towels were that old it was like getting dried by sandpaper the noise was all night terible place never again

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't send my worst enemy to this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: MeowfaceLA
Reviews.Content: I had originally planned on staying here 2 nights with a no cancellation fee but left after the first night and ate the money because this place was THAT BAD. After being greeted by a kid with attitude we walked to our room through the hotel which felt like the set of a bad horror movie. Yes, the location is good but you'll hear the entire city from your room ALL night. I, personally would rather sleep at night but that's just me. Speaking of sleep, how does one sleep on a bed that is wearing a diaper (yes a flimsy plastic cover) with a sheet over it? I don't. Did I mention that there's no internet either? As if all of this wasn't bad, we endured a loud buzzing noise coming from the ceiling all night and then had to deal with a VERY RUDE man behind the counter in the morning on the way out. That is not what I want to deal with on vacation. Do you?

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: jpl517
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel and liked it very much. It was a great location to walk right out and explore Barcelona. The room was very nice and comfortable and we even had our own balcony. The staff was helpful and the hotel was pleasant and quiet. The only thing we didn't like was that the breakfast was not included and was very expensive and not worth the money. Plus they never said anything about the cost of the breakfast when we checked in and there was no written information about breakfast anywhere except for times. We were a little disappointed about this but we learned we always need to ask about breakfast being included or not and if not how much it costs

Reviews.Title: “Great location but only stay if you just want somewhere to sleep”
Reviews.Author: John M
Reviews.Content: Arrived at approx 23:00. First impressions were not good, definitely not a four star - receptionist unwelcoming (we did have voucher though) no bar service or anyone in lobby. View from room was looking at walls of other rooms which meant very dark room even during the sunny days (was good for sleeping late!) Weird smell of sea water everywhere. To be honest we were not expecting much as we had read other reviews but went with it anyway purely for location. Located 5 minutes walk from La Rambla and Playa de Cataluyna. If looking for great location, a place just to rest your head and relatively cheap then this is the place - if looking for nice hotel with good services stay away.

Reviews.Title: “very nice for two first-timers in europe”
Reviews.Author: mrbynum
Reviews.Content: Really liked this place! It's adjacent to a government bldg that sits on a huge, old courtyard. The surrounding bldgs were beautiful old gothics that really had the old european feel. The hotel was just steps away from all the happening areas. My wife and I stayed here for an anniversary and would go back again. Cons: twin beds pushed together to make king but they would drift apart. The breakfast buffet was disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Decent enough, but don not expect too much”
Reviews.Author: raybkchan
Reviews.Content: Me and a friend had come on a holiday, booked this hotel because of its great location right in the heart of the the Gothic Quarter next to a metro stop and reasonable price for accomodation - breakfast included. It was pleasent enough reception staff were very friendly and nice except we were given the wrong room first but was quickly changed. Except we ended up with a room with a balcony door that had a broken handle and could not be locked or shut properly. We told this to staff the next morning, but when we came back in the evening, the night shift receptionist was rude, defensive and sarcastic asking why we were telling him now at this time of night (he misunderstood us) then afterwards said "if you told us then it will be fixed then". It hadn't been fixed but rather than cause a scene we just left it for the remained of the holiday as it was reasonably safe. The next day - went out and came back at 1am, the receptionist was missing and the entrance had been locked. After 5 minutes, the same night receptionist popped his head up from upstairs. Then took another 5 minutes to open the door. Went back to the room, key didn't work, but got rectified straight away. Throughout the rest of our stay, the same receptionist continued being rude and condescending which wasn't appreciated at all. Otherwise the rest of the staff were very friendly and professional. The cleaning staff was very professional but when we wanted to let her know she only needed to clean the the sheets we found out she did not understand Spanish, Catalan or English! But we got our message across in the end but was surprising nonetheless. We slept in a first floor room facing the street. Be warned that the Gothic Quarter is a hive of activity at night with plenty of bars, clubs , eateries etc and is full of loud people and street cleaners (trucks) well into the morning. If you are a light sleeper, take some earplugs with you! The breakfast provided is very good for value and has a great range for both meat eaters and vegetarians including cereals, breads, cooked and cold meats, fresh fruit and plenty of cold and hot beverages to get you up in the morning. Cannot really fault this part of our stay. Conclusion - Overall we were satisfied with the hotel. Don't expect to much from it and make the most of its great location in the centre of a great area and Barcelona itself. Our main gripe was that our complaint about the unclosable balcony door wasn't dealt with at all and the single member of staff working at night who was difficult and rude. But it was clean, comfortable, noise was bearable (just), and staff friendly and welcoming. In addition to this review here's a tip for stayers: DO NOT ASK FOR A TAXI FROM THE HOTEL. We had been on taxi trips in the night in Barcelona and the prices are reasonable. Taxi fares start at €2 but this driver decided to set his meter up from where he started arriving to us at €2.95 already! Then I noticed as soon as he set off it was going up by 5c every 2 metres! After getting to the end of the road we refused to stay in the taxi the fare was almost €6 by then. Compare this to just under €8 after midnight from the same place to Shoko bar in Barceloneta (check it on a map to see). He tried to convince us it costs €25 from Jaume 1 Metro Station to Placa de Catalunya which is frankly... insane - even at night prices. We had to argue and cause a fuss in public before he backed down and gave us back our luggage. We left without paying him.

Reviews.Title: “Never a 4 star!”
Reviews.Author: maggief_11
Reviews.Content: We were also moved to this hotel due to "water problems" at the one we had booked.The first room we were given did not even have a working lock on the door.We were moved to another room with tiny windows and no air conditioning working.The following morning after a really awful buffet breakfast we asked to be moved to our original choice of hotel but they still claimed nothing was available. We were moved to a room which did have a view out on to the street and also lots of ants in the bathroom! Reading other reviews it looks like this hotel is a dumping ground for this hotel group.

Reviews.Title: “A very poor hotel!”
Reviews.Author: 187062Karen
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in the heart of the nightlife, although you could not escape it in your room. It was so noisey it was impossible to sleep. There was no hot water at night. Cleaner was poor and did not replace soap etc. Staff were poor. The fact it has been awarded a four star is a joke.

Reviews.Title: “not bad but not 4 star quality”
Reviews.Author: chill1234
Reviews.Content: was originally booked in the Suizo, but on arrival was told they has problems with some rooms so was moved to the Barcino, very nice on arrival, room was ok,(1st floor) not large but ok for 2 ladies, straight away we found problems the balcony door was loose and had to be played around with to be opened or closed but still had a slight gap when shut! letting in some noise, this was quite bad at night especially with passing traffic and public, the bed i had had 2 cigarette burns in its cover (nice), the bath wouldnt drain very quickly and some insects came out of shower head when 1st turned on, and bath proceded to leak from below so had to keep a towel on the floor. quite disapointed that no tea making facilities either, overall was ok for a few nights stay but wouldnt recommend for a romantic trip and definately not a 4 star hotel

Reviews.Title: “good location, but the hotel bit dissapointing for 4 star”
Reviews.Author: Kasix
Reviews.Content: We were sent to this hotel as the one we originally booked had a water problem. (belonged to the same company thou) Good location, but may be noisy if you have a room with the street view. Our rooms had a back view - which was a grey wall !!!. Rooms very small, aircon not really working, fridge not working at all. Half of the staff not friendly and not helpful. Only one person from the reception that actually made any friendly conversation with us. Overall not worth money, would give 2 *, definattely not 4*

Reviews.Title: “Great location, reasonable quality but not special”
Reviews.Author: matt9871235
Reviews.Content: We were booked at Hotel del Mar but it was over booked (dont use dhr.com!) so moved here which is apparently a four start (rather than the del Mar three star). The location is genuinely phenomenal, in the heart of what the city has to offer and walking distance from anything worth visiting. The room was fine, small balcony, two twins rather than a double though I doubt any others were different. The bathroom was ok, occasionally unpleasant smell from the drain but not there most of the time, again something the city suffers in general I guess. Not the most spacious and fairly aged decour. Personally I am not sure its worth EUR120 a night, it gets a big hype but its fairly standard stuff. Breakfast was also mediocre at best, a range of cold and hots but not particularly high quality. One issue is the noise - bedrooms facing onto the street can be fairly noisy which is par for the area although could be tempered with improved glass / windows. Ear plugs?

Reviews.Title: “There have to be better hotels in the area!”
Reviews.Author: Curly_Girly_Traveler
Reviews.Content: We booked a one night stay here before our cruise ship left the next day. We got a great deal on it through another website and it was close to things we wanted to see, restaurants and the port - hence we booked. I mean it was a 4 star hotel after all! Check in was easy, but the elevator was tiny, barely fit us and our luggage. The hallways were so dark that you could barely see going down them. The room, while it did the job for 1 night, was nothing impressive or exciting. The bedding was old and in need of replacement, the bed was not comfortable at all, the room was very sterile and cold feeling, and it was noisy - mostly outside. The noise kept us up until about 3 am actually. Breakfast was 16 euro per person and not worth it, but we had to eat something. The elevators were hardly ever working right and we had to end up taking the stairs most of the time. The staff we encountered at the front desk did speak English so that was helpful. Overall, wouldn't stay here again - not 4 star worthy. The photos on their website are very deceptive. I found the best thing was the candies at the dish at the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4* hotel, 2* too many...”
Reviews.Author: tazzaha
Reviews.Content: This is definitely not a 4* hotel. The entrance looks quite impressive, but when you see the elevator, it is a bad sign for what is to come... There is only one elevator and you can hardly fit in it with 4 people. The room was large enough, considering you are in the old part of Barcelona, but the beds were very uncomfortable. They were hard and moved when you turned around in your sleep, very unpleasant! The bedlinnen was also a bit dirty, liked someone walked over it with muddy shoes. The bathroom was not in the best shape, mould in the corners and on the sealing. Some more negative points: - a crack in the floor where you can seriously injure your foot. - balcony door couldn't be locked completely as it was broken. Depending on who was sitting at the front desk, you would be treated nice or not. Not all the personnel took good care of the luggage, our flight was in the evening, so when we checked out we wanted to leave our luggage at the hotel. We were told to store it in a room and there was no lock or control of the room at all! The only good thing about this hotel is the location! Right in the middle of the Barri Gothic. We didn't have breakfast in the hotel, but nearby is a very nice bakery: Santa Clara. There is also a little shop at the other side of the street that sells very delicious fresh smoothies.

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay again.”
Reviews.Author: JSermarini
Reviews.Content: Street noise all night long. So loud it was like having a party in the room.

Reviews.Title: “I'll give 2* for this”
Reviews.Author: Bojannn
Reviews.Content: The best thing for this hotel is location...Room are terrible, but the bathroom is even worse. They have curtains in bathroom and I don’t know do they ever clean it ??? Beds are more than bad (really grate) and if you get up at night, you will stand on the cold marble floor because there is no carpet or towels for the feet. Hotel with 4* stars with no Internet, is it possible? Yes it is, there is no Internet. The only good thing for this hotel is that you are in the center of Barcelona. The TV in room has approximately 3 and a half programs :))) funny how scary. Its good that I was in this hotel just for one night. I won't come here ever, cause for that price you can find more more better hotel. PS. the picture from the room is when we check out so beds are not made up, sorry

Reviews.Title: “Okay hotel”
Reviews.Author: Frogonastick
Reviews.Content: We originally booked into the Hotel Rialto (because we've stayed there before and enjoyed it) but on arrival there was some problem so we'd been given a free ugrade to this hotel further up the road. This hotel was okay the rooms were clean if a little in need of upgrading. We had front facing rooms and these really could do with some double glazing. The street outside is nice and quiet during the day but at night is transformed into one of the busiest, noisiest streets around and the rubbish trucks arrive to empty the bins between 12 and 1 and night without fail. Didn't use the dining room, with all the great cafes around there was no need.

Reviews.Title: “we were robbed of our money left in the room's safe”
Reviews.Author: NNN2009
Reviews.Content: We would like to take this opportunity to warn the tourists planning a trip to the beautiful city of Barcelona. In GRAN HOTEL BARSINO, located at Carrer de Jaume I, 6 we were robbed of our money left in the room's safe the night before our departure. Before we left the room we locked the safe and placed the key in the locked suitcase. Upon return late at night after a wonderful evening in town, which must have been around 1 a.m., we opened the door with our magnetic card and could not turn the light on. The doorman couldn't help us either. He told us there was no one available to assist us and he was the only employee at that time. He provided us with a flashlight. As the room was dark we couldn't possibly notice the theft, which had probably been all carefully thought through. In the morning we noticed that the suitcase lock was broken, the safe key was missing. The doorman opened the safe at our request using the duplicate key. Passports, medical insurance policies, tickets, credit card and jewelry was all in place, but cash was gone - about 500 euros and 2 thousand rubbles. We declared the theft immediately to the doorman, but he directed us to police. We didn't have any time to go to the police station as we were about to catch our plane. It's not hard to imagine that everything was carefully planned, unlikely without hotel's personnel help.

Reviews.Title: “Give it a miss!”
Reviews.Author: GC-Poole
Reviews.Content: Good position. Reception staff completely unhelpful and service very poor. Hotel very dark - photos on web site very misleading. Poor facilities - no meals other than breakfast. Room smelt of smoke. Certainly not 4 star - one at best.

Reviews.Title: “great location, awful hotel. No way is this a 4 star!”
Reviews.Author: BLT_Chester
Reviews.Content: I'll start by saying this hotel is clean and in a superb location for Las Ramblas and nearby Metro (Juame I). I a normal bloke who thought he was booking a nice hotel for a short city break with his wife. So I thought I would spend a bit more and get a nice hotel - in summary I would say the web site portrays a nice looking 4 star hotel, something this place is not - don't stay here. Before I went I e-mailed the hotel to ask about breakfast and never got a reply, this was an early warning as to the awful service given by the reception staff. They just didn't seem to be bothered, one in particular can only be described as rude and obnoxious. The room was clean but quite small and basic. No tea/coffee facilities, a broken mini bar and a balcony door that didn't shut properly, nor would the door lock. I asked three times for it to be fixed and got fobbed off. Eventually we got moved to another room, only after being told "what are you complaining about, you are getting a bargain?". Not sure £150 for one night is a bargain. The new room was much better (still basic though) but the treatement had soured things for me. Breakfast was not bad, but expensive (16 euros each). I would not recommend this hotel, it is basic with awful staff. I would however recommend staying somewhere else as Barca is an amazing place to visit!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and clean”
Reviews.Author: jwsuh99
Reviews.Content: I came in with low expectations, and was pleasantly surprised with the accommodations although it certainly is not a 4-star hotel like it claims. Careful, this is a long and detailed review. Location: it is in the Gothic quarter of Barcelona, or basically the very heart of the city. I found most everything within walking distance: Las Ramblas was a 5 minute walk. The Picasso museum was also 5 minutes. The old Cathedral was 2 minutes away. The Metro was about 500 feet away. You get the idea. Room: we stayed in room 403. It was the North-Western corner of the hotel: basically the corner closest to the nearby Plaza and facing the street. Because it was a corner room, we had 2 large balcony-type windows that opened up nicely for a great view, and also allowed a lot of light in. Also because it was a corner room, you could hear everything from the streets and there was not good sound isolation. We are night owls so we didn't care but for those that do: bring ear plugs. The room was very clean, but pretty dated. The furniture was clean and didn't smell, but was worn-out in places. It was fine, though. It had 2 twinbeds put together that did fit flush next together (although I booked a room that specified 1 double bed), and it was fine. They were comfy, and the sheets were clean. The room was pretty large by European standards. I certainly had enough room for all our stuff, and had things sprawled out and there was still plenty of room to go about your business. The bathroom was also relatively large and clean. If I could guess the dimensions, it's about 12' x 8'. It had an old style tub+shower, with good pressure and good heat. It had 2 sinks with a stone countertop. Hairdryer worked great, and it had the basic stuff: sewing kit, soaps, etc. Toilet and bidet were clean and flushed well. There was an in-room safe which operated fine. The closet space was enough for us, and there was a tube TV which we didn't use. Access: there were ramps to easily roll your luggage around stairs in the lobby. Also, there was 1 tiny elevator, that could barely fit 5 people. But at least if you are wheelchair bound or something, this hotel can accommodate you. Services: the reception spoke very little English. You could get by, but if you know a lick of Spanish it goes a long way. They were pleasant and helpful enough, except this one guy who seemed to be very disinterested to struggle with his English (he was very friendly and nice to this Spanish couple that was just before us). We asked for a wake up call one day and they were 15 minutes late with the call. Internet: there was wifi internet that you had to pay for. They dont have a computer for you, you must use your own if you have one. I didn't. Room service: they were fine. Courteous. Breakfast: i don't remember the exact cost but it was something like 12Euro/person. We didn't eat this so i can't comment. Bar: there was a bar but i never saw it open. Wouldve been nice to have quick access to a relaxing cocktail to wind down your evening but i doubt they were running the bar anytime recently. In all, this hotel was a great bang-for the buck, and if I ever visit Barcelona again, I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough but 4*?”
Reviews.Author: CL_Cardiff
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week in March 2009 and for the price (85EUR/night + tax), it wasn't bad. I have to agree with previous reviewers regarding the sound insulation. The noise from the street, while not excessive, is round the clock and reverberates in the narrow streets. The windows do not provide good insulation and we have stayed in hotels in Barcelona in far noisier locations where the windows kept the noise out much more effectively. The windows also did not lock securely which was a little unnerving. The hotel could really do with spending a little money on this. The rooms are ok and reasonably well furnished, nice floors, comfortable beds. Bathroom was basic (I prefer to see a bit of marble in a 4 star!) but functional. Location is excellent - particularly appreciated the proximity to Santa Clara cake and coffee shop (Who needs a hotel breakfast when you have that?!). Also very handy for metro when wanting to travel outside gothic quarter. Would recommend it to anyone wanting a basic place to stay as long as they got it at the right price but it's not somewhere to go for a special treat. .

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, But 4 Star?”
Reviews.Author: liliIreland
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights,supposed to stay in Rialto but were told when we got there it was being renovated and we had been upgraded to their sister hotel which was 4 star.Would hate to have seen the 3 star.Room was clean,but quite small.We shared a balcony with the room next door.Our balcony doors were broken and could be opened from the balcony outside.Told staff and someone came to fix it,but it took them 4 hours to come.Location is ideal,a stroll to Ramblas,and loads of restaurants and bars nearby.Found staff friendly,some didn't speak much english,but thats fine,why should they,theyr'e spanish and with a bit of patience and hand gestures we were able to understand.Rooms were cleaned every day.Didn't go to restaurant,but on our last night decided to have a drink in the bar about 10.30 but were told the bar man had gone home so we couldn't.Barcelona is a beautiful city,but like all cities its not cheap.Bring your walking shoes,walking is the best way to see it. I would go back to this hotel,but all we did was sleep in it,so it did us fine.Would definately not say its a 4 star though,plus we were at he front of hotel on 2nd floor and we could hear everything outside,so not for light sleepers.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here!”
Reviews.Author: lalalalalala_8
Reviews.Content: Do not stay in this hotel! There is no way this hotel deserves four stars. I had no water in the shower - two days in a row! The staff would not help me (reception staff hardly speaks English) or allow me to change rooms. I had to shower in a colleague's room the first day and did not shower the second day. Some rooms (mine!) are ridiculously small - I didn't even have any room to put my suitcase down. In addition I couldn't control the heat in my room: I slept with an open window and ranging heater. I was in Barcelone for a conference and would expect a four star hotel to have internet wifi and a desk in each room, but no. Furthermore, it was noisy. When I complained at check-out, I was completely ignored. So: - no water to shower - tiny rooms - no climat control - noise - unfriendly & incapable staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: StockholmTom
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for three nights and had a great time in Barcelona although it was raining for most of the time. The hotel was smaller than the impression you get from pictures. It was clean (cleaning every day), the room was accomodating in size and standard, not overly extravagant but not rough. Bathroom was ok and clean. The only really big problem was the insulation. At night (if you got a room facing the street as we did) it sounded as if the people were actually in your room or at least that a window was open which was not the fact. Also loud noise from other rooms such as clicking shoes and scraping of furniture. The real plus is it's fantastic location right in the middle of old town, 5 minutes walking to Las Ramblas, the port or Plaza Catalunya. Breakfast was a let down as it did not have great variation, but for Spain I think it was the norm. The last morning though the staff (=person) in the restaurant was nowhere to be seen and the coffee was cold. The staff of the reception took the anomality with perfect calm and was not overly concearned by this... No coffee until the airport therefore. I would give the hotel three stars although it gives a rather elegant impression when you get out of your taxi the first time and see all the chandeliers and marble floors, but in the corridors and room it's more of a three star. We did leave rather happy as we tend to be a bit suspicious of the classification of hotels and therefore we did not have overly great expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Basil would be proud.”
Reviews.Author: bigjackYorkshire
Reviews.Content: For a "4 Star" this is a no go area. You have to have nerves of steel to get through the experience. Staff who go out of their way NOT to help. No hot water,noisy rooms poorly maintained & dire breakfasts to boot. Poor facilities in the rooms & not very much information about the hotel or the city. For the price we maybe expected a miracle to happen & just for once the web site would be truthful!!!!!!!! The only good point was its location. Ah well ,another lesson learnt.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay here!”
Reviews.Author: mascaroni
Reviews.Content: Spain: Hotel Barcino, Barcelona: "Great stay!" Date: September 13, 2008 Reviewer: Ron Mascarenhas, Kuwait My wife and I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. After reading some previous reviews we were apprehensive, but were pleasantly surprised. The staff were extremely helpful and spoke reasonably good English. The rooms had recently been refurbished. The hotel is located in the Gothic district on St. Jaume street which has many souvenir shops and restaurants and close to the La Rambla. The Jaume street is a bit noisy as the youth party all night, however it all adds to the holiday fun. A hot & cold buffet breakfast was included in our room price and had a good selection of spanish dishes No disappointments at this hotel and the location couldn't have been better.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Clean, Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: mj5286
Reviews.Content: I don't know why anyone is so crabby about this hotel. My boyfriend and I stayed there and found everything to be just fine. The location is wonderful - just steps to La Rambla, the cathedral, and public transportation. The staff spoke English better than any other Spanish person we came in contact wtih. They were rude, my "Hi, we'd like to check in." was met with a "Who are you?" instead of something friendly, but that's not enough to ruin our trip. It was a large room, everything was clean, it had a nice bathroom, and a great terrace overlooking the street. Breakfast wasn't included and we didn't even walk over by their bar so I can't comment on that. The only thing questionable was the safety of the luggage room, it's not locked and they don't keep an eye on who goes in and out, but we didn't have any problems. They did take a copy of our passports upon check in but I've never checked into a hotel in Europe that didn't. Bottom line: this is a clean place with a great location that I would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Verrrrry Baddd”
Reviews.Author: cm028
Reviews.Content: Gran Hotel Barcino... I've stayed here 3 nights (140 Euros / night) in June 2008 and it supposed to be a 4 stars hotel...Yeah right!!! The bathroom and the room is the size of a normal bathroom. The elevator is enought for 2 people max. The view is miserable (pipes) and it is not even cleaned. I strongly encourage everyone not book in this hotel... I would rate this hotel as 1.5 star hotel. The staff are ok (depending on the shift) but really do not care about you. The bar is closed. The bed is very small and is so poorly decorated. Of course, the walls are so thin that you can hear all noises your neighboors make. The bar is closed. There is no pool, gym, restaurant, iron, landry, etc.... The only good thing about this hotel is the location. It is well located (town) which is a good thing because you do not want to stay in the hotel too long!!!

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay At This Hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: DorisMorris
Reviews.Content: It was my daughter's hen weekend with 18 girls aged from 15 to 51 - we were so looking forward the trip until we got to the hotel. In all my life I have never met such rude and obnoxious. They would not accept the hotel vouchers - they took photocopies of all the passports and credit cards - which they lost so identity fraud here we come. The rooms were quite nice but we were stuck in the well of the hotel and so so hot and stuffy - 3 people stuck in a room meant for 2 with a bathroom you couldn't swing a cat in. They blocked 1 of our rooms as they wouldn't accept that it was paid for even though we had proof with our hotel vouchers. The key cards hardly ever worked and the staff never wanted to re-scan them. Never put anything in the safe as one of the staff said that because they are key safe's they are easy to open as thieves have copied them. Do not ask the reception staff to order you a cab - they won't. Do not ask them to fill the mini-bar - they tell you to go to the supermarket. Breakfast for a 4* hotel was awful - few cereals, uncooked bacon and snotty eggs, few croisants if you were lucky. Do not expect 4* as this was definately a 2*. Oh, and the bar was NEVER open. The only good point was that it was central. Sorry, as that is the only good point about Grand Hotel Barcino - I could go on quite alot more but hey ho. DO NOT STAY THERE IT WILL SPOIL YOUR HOLIDAY.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location.”
Reviews.Author: warranty
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Gran Hotel Barcino in Dec 2007, during our 3-day stay in Barcelona. The hotel's location is ABSOLUTELY unbeatable. It's literally a stone's throw away from the historic Plaza St. Jaume, and just a short short walk from the cathedral, the main pedestrian walk Las Ramblas, as well as many other cute little neighborhoods, tapas restaurants, bars, bakeries, etc. The staff service attitude can be "indifferent" sometimes but since we were never in any hurry I think it's "okay." The room was okay, but at least it was clean, thought it can be a little noisy (revelers on the street partied into the early morning hours during our stay) if you are a light sleeper w/o ear plugs since it's kinda near the center of action. Overall, I think it's a great hotel given its superb location.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not 4* and really pushing 3*”
Reviews.Author: DCFMalaga
Reviews.Content: When we arrived our friends card key did not work and had no electricity due to this so they changed the room. The rooms were so HOT that although we live in Spain we found it unbearable and had to open the window and sleep all night everynight (four nights) like this even though it is November and the temperature outside was cold.. The noise was LOUD outside. We asked for the heating to be lowered but although they attempted it, it did not happen. Then we found our door didnot lock. We just pushed it and it opened! we spent ages each time we left the room trying to get it to stay shut - my husband went to the reception and the gentle man said 'this is Spain - things get broken ' my husband said 'could he arrange to have it repaired 'the reception said ' what was the point it would only be broken again!.The conversation went on in vain for at least another five minutes and never was repaired..Also the toilet syphon plunger didn't work we had to keep repairing it after use. Also the shower curtain rail came off the wall. Also the key to the mini bar lock wouldn't lock.Also the sink plug did not work so we had a dirty sink at all times. Also when the people upstairs had a shower - so did our bathroom and next doors! According to the concierge 'this is normal as it is Spain' We pointed out that we live in Spain and had never experienced this before in ten years of residence and he just smiled and shrugged. The bar was never open and a snack bar was not in existence - we could find no instructions as to the whereabouts of the breakfast room and just followed our noses. A dreadful experience all round not to be recommended.The only help we received was when we were leaving and an elderly gentleman on the desk assisted us with directions.

Reviews.Title: “Worst experience ever.”
Reviews.Author: djalal75
Reviews.Content: - leaking roof in the bathroom, refused to change the room for our 2 days stay. - only one elevator. - Small and expensive breakfast. - Very rude, brainless and careless concierge. Poor english and french speaking. It's not a 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Warning others: Terrible hotel”
Reviews.Author: nassepusen
Reviews.Content: This is one of the worst hotel I have everr stayed at. The bathroom was not completely clean, there was no body wash or enough shampoo. The staff CANNOT speak ENGLISH. The breakfast was cold, the tea and coffe cold, they've even put tap water in storebought bottles to fool the customers. AND plus, we payed for inclusive breakfast in our hotel rate when ordering online, but the receptionist made us pay additional 36 EUR because of someone misunderstanding with the agency,, they were rude and not friendly. Good location, but the experience was terrible, it felt like 2 star hotel.. Find something better!!

Reviews.Title: “Hmmmm Not so good”
Reviews.Author: Gilliy0812
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights and the hotel was okay for a bed for the night only. The minus The room was tired of appearance with cigarette burns on the bed-spread and cig ends on the balcony. The breakfast coffee was undrinkable. Really. The bathroom taps were stiff and dirty (they needed a real scrub). The plus The staff were nice. A good location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location comfy rooms”
Reviews.Author: SundayGrundle
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Barca for 2 nights over a very hot and busy weekend...was fantastic having a hotel in such a good location... just off the Ramblas. Some great shops and eateries nearby and hotel is within 5 mins walking distance of the main square in Barca. Breakfast was included and was quite nice...tasty traditional european breakfast. Overall a very good stay worth the $$$.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this charming hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ColoradoJanson
Reviews.Content: My husband and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay here! The location could not have been more perfect. The rooms were charming although not quiet. The breakfast buffet was diverse and delicious! We would stay here again in a heartbeat!

HotelInfo.Name: Gran Hotel Barcino
HotelInfo.Address: Jaime I , 6, 08002 Barcelona, Spain
